author: pauld.9606
content: I recall that this was discussed on ACD chat years ago. It was called something like "m-of-n clients".

author: pauld.9606
content: It may be wise for participants who are vulnerable to forks to monitor different implementations for consensus forks.

author: pauld.9606
content: For example, a miner who doesn't want to lose a full block reward to a fork may execute their block with multiple implementations, and if there is a consensus bug, build a different block. Exchanges who wish to prevent double spends of deposits may monitor various implementations for consensus forks as well. Infura and Etherscan may not care as much, unless their customers are vulnerable to forks.
